demographics.name: Mary Peterson
demographics.supportServices: Provided with info for local support groups.

diagnosis.primary: Invasive Ductal Carcinoma (IDC) of the Right Breast
diagnosis.receptorStatus: ER Positive (90%), PR Positive (70%), HER2 Negative
diagnosis.priorTreatmentSummary: Lumpectomy + Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy (02/10/2025) by Dr. Carter

treatmentPlan.modality: External Beam Radiation Therapy (EBRT) - Whole Breast RT (WBRT)
treatmentPlan.targetVolumeSummary: PTV encompassing the entire right breast tissue (PTV_Breast).
medications: Topical Steroid Cream (e.g., Mometasone) or Aquaphor PRN skin reaction (dermatitis)
Adjuvant Endocrine Therapy (e.g., Tamoxifen or Aromatase Inhibitor) - To be managed by Med Onc or Surgeon
therapistAlerts: Pay close attention to skin reaction in inframammary fold.
Ensure patient is using moisturizer as instructed.
Monitor for any signs of arm swelling (lymphedema), though risk is low.

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine on breast board, both arms abducted above head. SAD setup.
ctSimulation.referenceMarks: Tattoos placed per protocol. Wires placed on surgical scar and palpable breast borders for delineation.
ctSimulation.ctNotes: Non-contrast CT acquired in treatment position for 3D-CRT planning.

dosimetry.planStatus: Final - Approved by Dr. Angela Rossi
dosimetry.constraints: Heart Max < 15 Gy; Ipsilateral Lung V20Gy < 15%. All constraints met.

igrtProtocol.alignment: Match to chest wall and surgical clips.

fractions.setupNotes: kV pair imaging for setup verification. Matched to clips/chest wall.
fractions.notes: Patient instructions for skin care reviewed.

fractions.sideEffects: Mild skin pinkness (Grade 1 dermatitis) in inframammary fold.

fractions.notes: Completed 16/16 fx WBRT. Managed with Mometasone cream.

imagingAndReports.summary: Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, Grade 2. ER/PR+, HER2-.

reportDetails.receptorStatus: Estrogen Receptor (ER): Positive (90%, strong intensity). Progesterone Receptor (PR): Positive (70%, moderate intensity). HER2: Negative (IHC Score 1+). Ki-67: 15%.

imagingAndReports.summary: 1.8 cm IDC, Gr 2. Margins negative (>2mm). 0/2 SN positive. ER/PR+, HER2-.

reportDetails.procedure: Right Breast Lumpectomy and Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy

progressNotes.author: Dr. Helen Carter (Surgeon)
progressNotes.summary: Pt underwent R lumpectomy + SLNB. Path results: pT1c pN0(sn) IDC, margins neg. Pt recovering well. Refer to Rad Onc for adjuvant WBRT. Start Adjuvant AI (Letrozole) after RT completion.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Angela Rossi (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt s/p lumpectomy/SLNB for Stage IA ER+ breast cancer. Discussed benefits of adjuvant WBRT to reduce local recurrence risk. Recommended hypofractionated regimen (42.56Gy/16fx) via tangential fields. Explained procedure, skin care, potential side effects (dermatitis, fatigue, breast changes). Pt agrees. CT sim scheduled.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Angela Rossi (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt completed 8/16 fx. Tolerating well. Grade 1 dermatitis in inframammary fold, advised liberal use of Aquaphor. No significant fatigue. Continue RT.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Angela Rossi (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Completed 16/16 fx WBRT. Moderate erythema/dry desquamation (Grade 2 dermatitis) noted, managed with Mometasone cream. Fatigue mild. Plan for follow-up in 4-6 weeks. Reinforce importance of starting Letrozole with surgeon/med onc.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Adjuvant therapy to reduce risk of local recurrence after lumpectomy.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: Skin reaction (redness, dryness, peeling, itching - most common), fatigue, breast swelling/tenderness, potential long-term changes in breast appearance/texture, very low risk of other issues (e.g., rib fracture, lung/heart exposure).
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Importance of skin care (gentle washing, approved moisturizers, avoid irritants/sun exposure), managing fatigue (rest periods), reporting significant skin breakdown or pain.
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Attend daily RT appointments, perform skin care as instructed, attend weekly OTVs, report symptoms.
patientEducation.medicationCompliance: Use prescribed topical creams as directed. Follow instructions for starting endocrine therapy after RT.
